meanings.sent1: The exceptive rule allowed for special cases to be considered.
meanings.sent2: Her exceptive nature made her stand out from the rest of the group.
meanings.sent3: The cat's exceptive behavior of only eating fish on Fridays amused the family.
meanings.sent4: His exceptive taste in music was like a rare gem in a sea of common melodies.
meanings.sent5: The exceptive color of the flower made it impossible to miss in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The exceptive clause in the contract allowed for certain terms to be excluded.
meanings.sent2: The exceptive power of the machine made it versatile for various tasks.
meanings.sent3: The exceptive ability of the robot to avoid obstacles was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her exceptive skill in finding the right solution was like a magic trick.
meanings.sent5: The exceptive design of the building made it stand out among the rest of the structures.
